FuncDef:
The spatial-multicast command sets the bandwidth based on which load balancing is performed for P2MP TE or mLDP flows in a spatial multicast scenario.
The undo spatial-multicast command restores the default setting.
By default, the bandwidth based on which load balancing is performed for P2MP TE or mLDP flows is not set.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the bandwidth based on which load balancing is performed for P2MP TE or mLDP flows.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 40000000, in kbit/s.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set the bandwidth based on which load balancing is performed for P2MP TE or mLDP flows in a spatial multicast scenario, run the spatial-multicast p2mp-te mldp bandwidth command. For P2MP TE flows, specify the p2mp-te keyword. For mLDP flows, specify the mldp keyword. To delete the bandwidth setting, run the undo spatial-multicast p2mp-te mldp bandwidth command.
Precautions
A maximum of 1000 spatial-multicast p2mp-te mldp bandwidth command instances are supported.
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
